channel.title: Xxlegitxx and indiestyle vs. Jagex
channel.description:
http://newrs.info/openletter.txt
[quote="xxlegitxx"]Note - These emails are ordered in chronological order.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
From: Jagex Copyright Team <copyright@jagex.com> Date: Sep 24, 2007 7:45 PM Subject: Copyright Infringement To: **********@gmail.com
To whom it may concern,
My name is Tobias Bailey, I work as a member of Community Management for the game RuneScape (www.RuneScape.com) which is a massive multiplayer online game.
We have discovered a site registered under your address which infridges upon our legal rights and copyright.
http://newrs.info/
The site claims to offer a service within the game which in fact do not exist. The page will harvest player passwords so that the user of the site can go ahead and access other players' accounts within the game.
As well as this they are using images that are copyrighted by Jagex Ltd.
I would be very grateful if someone could look at this webpage with a view to having it removed, otherwise we will have no alternative but to protect our legal copyright using the fullest extent of the law. If you do not comply to this email within 7 days I will pass the matter onto our lawyers.
Sincerely
Tobias Bailey Copyright Enforcement Jagex Ltd.
--
IMPORTANT NOTICE
The sender does not guarantee that this message, including any attachment, is secure or virus free. Also, it is confidential and may be privileged or otherwise protected from disclosure. If you are not the intended recipient, do not disclose or copy it or its contents. Please telephone or email the sender and delete the message entirely from your system. Jagex Limited is a company registered in England & Wales with company number 03982706 and a registered office at St. Andrews House, 90 St. Andrews Road, Cambridge, CB4 1DL, UK.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
From: *********@gmail.com Date: Sep 24, 2007 9:13 PM EDT Subject: Re: Copyright Infringement To: Jagex Copyright Team <copyright@jagex.com>
If I may introduce myself, I am xxlegitxx, partner to Nemo ********, the registrant of the domain http://newrs.info/. Mr. ******** and I have discussed this matter thoroughly. The page has been temporarily disabled, yet we seek clarification as to which specific areas of the site are infringing upon Jagex Ltd. copyright, so we can adjust and redesign to comply with British and international copyright laws. For reference, you may access a disabled version of the original site here: http://******************
I must note that from this point on, references to "you" or "your corporation" refer to Jagex Ltd. as a whole, while "this site" and "our site" will refer to http://newrs.info/.
False claims and "scam" websites abound on the internet. That you would refer your team of lawyers to a site which receives less than 80 hits a day gives tribute to the fact that your corporation pursues money rather than client satisfaction. It is not the prospect of dissatisfied clients that moves your corporation; rather, it is the prospect of lost profits.
In continuation, I genially suggest that Jagex divert resources from your bloated law department to your pathetic customer support team. Reportedly, I can receive better customer service buying a can of Coca- Cola than by paying for a sixty dollar's worth of membership from your corporation. More paying customers are given "black marks" or banned unfairly than are driven away by this site and the copyrights it infridges upon. According to a recent poll held by one of your largest fan sites, Zybez.net, 47% of your customers have had a bad experience with RuneScape Customer Support. I assure you, this number is nothing to boast about.
Finally, I also might mention that this site could only possibly "scam" the feeble minds of sub-thirteen year olds. Your corporation appears to care so much about the safety of these preteens, yet you allow them access to "the Game" despite the self-declared risk of providing too much personal information online or communicating with strangers they encounter online. Of course, as they are paying customers, your corporation must have no objection.
I now realize that the Ltd. in "Jagex Ltd." represents not the liability of the corporation, but the amount of effort Jagex takes to protect its users. I rue the day when players of "the Game" realize the amount of money they have poured into the "scam" that is RuneScape. That day, I shall have no paying customers requesting websites or domains for the sake of harvesting RuneScape players' passwords.
With Utmost Sincerity,
xxlegitxx and Nemo ******** http://newrs.info/
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Awaiting a reply...
--------------------------------------------------------------------------[/quote]
WHO WILL WIN? ;)

item.title: Xxlegitxx and indiestyle vs. Jagex
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

Bobby:

the solictitors part.

the solictitors part.
[/quote]

same[/quote]

http://www.google.com.au/search?hl=en&sa=X&oi=spell&resnum=0&ct=result&cd=1&q=define:+Solicitor&spell=1

"In the United Kingdom and countries having a similar legal system the legal profession is divided into two kinds of lawyers: the solicitors who contact and advise clients, and barristers who argue cases in court (known as Advocates in Scotland). In cases where a trial is necessary a client has to hire a solicitor, who will advise him and then retain a barrister on his behalf. "

“A solicitor is a legally qualified individual who has a general duty to advise their clients on matters of law in the UK. They are fully regulated by the Law Society”

One click, some typing, another click, and you’re done.
How easy is that?

Read full topic

item.title: Xxlegitxx and indiestyle vs. Jagex
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

Mopman:

xxlegitxx seems to not understand the difference between “having a team of lawyers” and “contacting a solicitor”. Jagex do not hire a law department, they simply pay Adlex to do their legal work, like any other company on the planet. They would not even be able to be “Jagex Ltd.” without contracting a solicitor.

Thanks. Someone who knows the business world =)

Read full topic
